events.title: Amistad Case Verdict
events.description: The U.S. Supreme Court ruled that the Africans who had seized control of the ship La Amistad in an uprising had been illegally enslaved and had the right to fight for their freedom, freeing them from charges of mutiny and murder.
events.significance: This landmark case was a significant moment in the abolitionist movement in the United States and heightened tensions over slavery.

events.title: Battle of Verdun begins
events.description: One of the longest and bloodiest battles of World War I began when the German army launched a major offensive against French forces at Verdun, France.
events.significance: Verdun became a symbol of French determination and suffering, with massive casualties on both sides, profoundly impacting WWI's course.

events.title: The 'Day the Music Died' Plane Crash
events.description: Buddy Holly, Ritchie Valens, and J.P. "The Big Bopper" Richardson died in a plane crash near Clear Lake, Iowa, a crash later immortalized in Don McLean's song 'American Pie.'
events.significance: The deaths of these pioneering rock and roll musicians marked a tragic loss for the music world and symbolized the end of an era.

events.title: Dunblane Massacre in Scotland
events.description: Thomas Hamilton killed 16 children and one teacher at Dunblane Primary School before committing suicide, the deadliest mass shooting in British history.
events.significance: The tragedy led to significant reforms in UK gun laws, including the banning of handguns in Great Britain.
